result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon J Walkup was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assesment, treatment, and counseling as deemed required by PO.
Random drug and alcohol screening/testing.
NO day jail credit if revoked.
*AMENDED: Length of probation reduced to 1 year. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon J Walkup

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC to Judge Falstad re: clarification of length of probation
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:50 am 
INCLUDES 14CF261 AND 15CF54. 
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Robin Kennedy.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 14CF261: Ct. 2 (Misd. Retail Theft/Repeater/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF54: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF261: Ct. 1 (Felony Theft/Repeater/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF54: Ct. 2 (Misd. Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: 40 hours community service; assessment/treatment/counseling as required by PO including AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol; random drug/alcohol screening/testing; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; court costs.  
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 11:10 am

Case Called: 8:36am. INCLUDES 15CF54, 14CF261. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Robin Kennedy. State recites history of matter - Defendant was to show proof that she was in hospitial. Atty Kennedy makes statement - moves for no BFH and set Plea this week. State makes further statements and does not move to forfeit bond. Crt will not forfeit bond. DATES: Set Plea. Adjourned:  8:38am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): SHopko on 18th Ave in Wausau. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
